item.title: Single yellow line for parking restriction worn out/missing., 27th July
item.description:
This 50 metre stretch of single yellow line has been invisible for nearly a year. There is a time plate showing the parking restriction from 8am till 6.30pm mon-sat. Enforcement officers have been spoken to and state they are frustrated and powerless as the legal signage (the yellow line is not visible. They state that they have complained about this situation for months - to no avail. The reason I’m reporting this is that the parked vehicles cause obstructions, delays, traffic jams and also Bus delays. This road has several Bus routes. The problem is easily remedied with some yellow paint. I’m surprised that TfL have not complained . This problem frequently causes. Blockages at the Sidcup station traffic lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Crescent, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lot of rubbish left on walkway, 27th July
item.description:
Via the alley on the left of the playground behind the houses people are fly tipping all the time . They through all sorts of stuff over the fence near my property blocking my exit through the back gate.They also left laughing gas bottles all over the place. Also they left rubbish black bags which I clear myself.You should install signs to say no fly tipping and install cameras and lights. It is outrageous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eglinton Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree has constricting bike lock wrapped around trunk, 27th July
item.description:
Tree (ginko balboa) outside 13A Macclesfield St has had a bike lock wrapped around its trunk for some time which is going to start damaging the tree if it has not done so already. Please could you remove ? Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Shaftesbury Avenue, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
